column4: can anyone help me with my nvidia problems? i've posted the Xorg.conf here: http://pastebin.com/271287
that's not your xorg.conf ;) (it's /var/log/Xorg.0.log)
hehe, sorry, i meant the Xorg.0.log
what do you reckon the problem is? i can't start x with the "nvidia" driver
I'm looking it the log now.  Is that the whole thing?
yep
hard to say, particularly since you installed from nvidia's binaries, rather than ubuntu packages
how do i remove the binaries?
I've never used them, so I can't say
how do i verify if open gl is running as it should?
I'm not sure of the best way...
or others, does this: (WW) NVIDIA(0): Bad V_BIOS checksum    cause a problem?
it could, but at least that's just a warning
x won't start with the nvidia-driver so the error must be in the xorg.0.log?
it should be, yes
you're not using the 7174 version nvidia drivers?
no, i'm using 6629
how come?
i couldnt get glxinfo running at all... segmentation fault
i tried reinstalling and removing, using ubuntu nvidia etc
that's bizarre.  I remember from yesterday that you installed the nvidia biniaries instead of ubuntu packages.  Were you unable to uninstall them?
